alert.note: Alert for Dundy (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 06 at 10:29PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern Cheyenne County in east central Colorado, southeastern Yuma County in northeastern Colorado, eastern Kit Carson County in east central Colorado, western Wallace County in west central Kansas, Cheyenne, western Sherman Counties in northwestern Kansas and southwestern Dundy Counties in southwestern Nebraska through 1015 PM MDT/1115 PM CDT/... At 929 PM MDT/1029 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles east of Haigler to 11 miles southeast of Cheyenne Wells. Movement was east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. These storms will remain over mainly rural areas of eastern Cheyenne County in east central Colorado, southeastern Yuma County in northeastern Colorado, eastern Kit Carson County in east central Colorado, western Wallace County in west central Kansas, Cheyenne, western Sherman Counties in northwestern Kansas and southwestern Dundy Counties in southwestern Nebraska, including the following locations... Hale, Laird and Beecher Island. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 in Kansas between mile markers 0 and 14. Interstate 70 in Colorado between mile markers 432 and 450. Highway 385 between mile markers 141 and 221, and between mile markers 223 and 224. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding and reduced visibility. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
